alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 7:19PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Bonner, northwestern Shoshone and northeastern Kootenai Counties through 700 PM PDT... At 617 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Athol, or 9 miles northeast of Hayden, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. This storm is also producing torrential downpours. Up to a half inch of rain will likely be produced in less than an hour over some locations resulting in standing water in low-lying areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Athol, Hayden Lake and Chilco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Idaho between mile markers 25 and 28. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 437 and 451. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle
